edu.eur.absa.model

Class Dataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.eur.absa.model.Dataset

  • public class Dataset
extends java.lang.Object
    Dataset is the container for all Spans that are processed together. Contains no textual information apart from that, but instead gives the tools for data set management. It allows you to use an arbitrary spanType and divide the data set into training/validation/test based on that.
    Author:
    Kim Schouten

    • Method Detail

      • createSubSets

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.HashSet<Span>> createSubSets(java.lang.String spanType,
                                                                  double... subSetProportions)
        Divide the data into subsets, using the given spanType as the level to divide on. This means all Spans of the given type will be gathered and randomly distributed over the folds while adhering to the given subSetProportions. This does not imply that an Algorithm works on that particular level of analysis, just that the data is divided using these. For instance, dividing on the "sentence" spans, means that sentences will be randomly assigned to any of the subsets, independent from where adjacent sentences will be assigned. However, the Algorithm might try to predict the sentiment for each of the "aspect" spans contained within a sentence. The boolean useAllData is used to determine whether any leftover Spans will be put in the last subset (when true) or simply left out (when false). Default is true.
        Parameters:
        spanType -
        subSetProportions - These should sum up to one.
        Returns:
        The data split into subsets, put together in a list. Last one in the list is the test set.

      • createSubSets
